item.title: Alaska Native Vietnam Era Veterans Land Allotment Extension Act of 2025

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

cdata.text:
Alaska Native Vietnam Era Veterans Land Allotment Extension Act

This bill extends for an additional five years the time period during which an eligible Alaska Native veteran may apply for a land allotment under the Alaska Native Vietnam Era Veterans Land Allotment Program. The program makes Alaska Native veterans who served in the Armed Forces in Vietnam between August 5, 1964, and December 31, 1971, or their heirs eligible to receive up to 160 acres of federal land in Alaska.

Under the current program, the Department of the Interior's Bureau of Land Management may accept applications through December 29, 2025. This bill extends this time period for an additional five years to December 29, 2030.

bill.title: Alaska Native Vietnam Era Veterans Land Allotment Extension Act

item.title: Alaska Native Vietnam Era Veterans Land Allotment Extension Act
Alaska Native Vietnam Era Veterans Land Allotment Extension Act
A bill to extend the Alaska Native Vietnam era Veterans Land Allotment Program.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
